com.gnahraf.test

Class RandomSequence

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gnahraf.test.RandomSequence

  • public class RandomSequence
extends Object
    A random access, random sequence. This probably doesn't work so well (in terms of the random sequence's statistics), but it might be good enough for testing purposes. The idea is to be able to access the nth value in the sequence without having to iterate through the n - 1 values before it.

    Thread Safety

    Not safe for concurrent access!

    Author:
    Babak

    • Constructor Detail

      • RandomSequence

        public RandomSequence(long seed,
              int seedRate)
        Parameters:
        seed - the starting seed
        seedRate - the rate at which the seed is reset. Every sampleRate invocations of next() resets the generator's seed. Designed for use in hundreds; must be at least 2.

    • Method Detail

      • initSeed

        public final long initSeed()

      • next

        public long next()

      • index

        public final long index()
        Returns the index associated with next invocation of next(). (The index of the previous invocation of next() is one less than this.)
        See Also:
        jumpTo(long)

      • seedRate

        public final int seedRate()
        The rate at which the underlying random number generator's seed is reset.
        Returns:

      • jumpTo

        public RandomSequence jumpTo(long index)
        Jumps to the given index. On return, index() returns supplied argument. With few exceptions, jumping to a multiple of the seed rate is more efficient.
